pr_title: KOGITO-987 - VsCode editor - process id not saved/updated

timeline.message:
KOGITO-987 - VsCode editor - process id not saved/updated

This fix uses the recent added capability of "flushing" added in this JIRA:
KOGITO-1219. The flush method is called each time the document content is requested.
Providing updated content each time.

timeline.bodyText:
this method should not be public, otherwise doesn't make sense the arguments for the flush(ClientSession, String) method, as each session (editor) will have a different associated FormsContainer instance, which could not be the one set in  setCurrentContainer...
Can you please change it to package protected access (so no access modifier set)? Does it work/make sense for you?
